commit_message:
Add posibility to set custom name for upgrade tar file

Closes-Bug: #1337385
Change-Id: If2a6da37264270dacde0c95aa534e281398b2446
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/44/104844/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: rm -f $(TARBALL_PATH) tar Af $(TARBALL_PATH) $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/fuel-part.tar tar Af $(TARBALL_PATH) $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/openstack-part.tar tar Af $(TARBALL_PATH) $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/common-part.tar # gzip $(TARBALL_PATH) rm -f $(FUEL_TARBALL_PATH) tar Af $(FUEL_TARBALL_PATH) $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/fuel-part.tar tar Af $(FUEL_TARBALL_PATH) $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/common-part.tar rm -f $(OS_TARBALL_PATH) tar Af $(OS_TARBALL_PATH) $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/openstack-part.tar tar Af $(OS_TARBALL_PATH) $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/common-part.tar
deleted_lines: rm -f $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/fuel-$(PRODUCT_VERSION)-upgrade.tar tar Af $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/fuel-$(PRODUCT_VERSION)-upgrade.tar \ $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/fuel-part.tar tar Af $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/fuel-$(PRODUCT_VERSION)-upgrade.tar \ $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/openstack-part.tar tar Af $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/fuel-$(PRODUCT_VERSION)-upgrade.tar \ $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/common-part.tar # gzip $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/fuel-$(PRODUCT_VERSION)-upgrade.tar rm -f $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/master-upgrade-$(PRODUCT_VERSION).tar tar Af $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/master-upgrade-$(PRODUCT_VERSION).tar $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/fuel-part.tar tar Af $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/master-upgrade-$(PRODUCT_VERSION).tar $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/common-part.tar rm -f $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/openstack-upgrade-$(PRODUCT_VERSION).tar tar Af $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/openstack-upgrade-$(PRODUCT_VERSION).tar $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/openstack-part.tar tar Af $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/openstack-upgrade-$(PRODUCT_VERSION).tar $(BUILD_DIR)/upgrade/common-part.tar

subject: Introduces script for updating horizon config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-20 15:21:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard/commit/5cefc459a79c139c2f75ca7c70d622d447779d4a', 'message': 'Sync developer settings

Update installation script to support Django 1.6.5

Change-Id: I6e947f8887dfdcdc1f5651dd6acdc28bf9d924bf
Closes-Bug: #1332557:wq
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-24 14:11:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard/commit/3e4488f0e1872023f6adff9a81a76e8352c3d541', 'message': 'Introduces script for updating horizon config

Since now, all custom murano settings stores at update_settings.sh
so it exempts from maintaining two config files at the same time.
This script intends to update developer config and production config.

Usage:

./update_settings

Arguments:
--input={FILE}    File to which Murano data will be added, if skipped horizon config from git repository will be downloaded
--output={FILE}   File to store the result file, if skipped it equals to the --input
--log-file={FILE} File to store murano dashboard logs instead of default output
--remove          Remove Murano data from the specified file

Change-Id: I6e947f8887dfdcdc1f5651dd6acdc28bf9d924bf
Closes-Bug: #1332557
Implemets: blueprint separate-muranodashboard-config
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-06-24 15:38:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard/commit/130184f5e311439261d4eefe57460305b3e53c1a', 'message': 'Introduces script for updating horizon config

commit_message:
Introduces script for updating horizon config

Since now, all custom murano settings stores at update_settings.sh
so it exempts from maintaining two config files at the same time.
This script intends to update developer config and production config.

Usage:

./update_settings

Arguments:
--input={FILE}    File to which Murano data will be added, if skipped horizon config from git repository will be downloaded
--output={FILE}   File to store the result file, if skipped it equals to the --input
--log-file={FILE} File to store murano dashboard logs instead of default output
--remove          Remove Murano data from the specified file

To update developer settings use the following command:
========================================================
update_setting.sh --output="muranodashboard/settings.py"
========================================================

Change-Id: I6e947f8887dfdcdc1f5651dd6acdc28bf9d924bf
Closes-Bug: #1332557
Implemets: blueprint separate-muranodashboard-config

commit_message:
Fixed issue with Neutron RPC workers

Neutron doesn't support RPC workers, need to remove this
parameter from Neutron configuration file.

Change-Id: Ie3110676d9170097ed6e806eea4d4cebc6b056d5
Closes-Bug: #1337334

Add ceilometer compute notifications ostf tests

Refactor all ceilometer ostf tests and add tests for
ceilometer compute notifications: memory, vcpus, disk.root.size,
disk.ephemeral.size

commit_message:
Add network service tag to compute tests

This commit adds the network service tag to all the compute api tests
that are using network services so that they're properly tagged.

Partially implements bp add-service-tags

commit_message:
Fix disk_available_least in JSON schemas

The hypervisor JSON schemas were not consistent with the value for
disk_available_least. One allowed for 'null' values, but the other
two did not. This allows 'null' in all schemas (Ironic does not
set this value so it will be 'null' when the compute api tests
are run).

Closes-Bug: #1337416

Change-Id: I71e6c5f0800f7641c49d8058596831f011328ec2

commit_message:
Fix bad log message with glance client timeout

Fixes bad log message where when a glance call finally timeouts instead
of a log message saying that it has given up it instead says it is
retrying

Co-Authored-By: qinchenchong@gmail.com

Change-Id: I325918f2d7fa971d4239343131b0f95dae293281
Closes-Bug: 1292993

commit_message:
Libvirt-Enable suppport for discard option for disk device

Support setting discard option for instance's disk.
If discard option is enabled, unused/freed blocks can be return back to the
storage device.

blueprint libvirt-disk-discard-option

Change-Id: Idcf7b35c93422d0d13c3ffb33aca3c5eca4f3c94
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/56/85556/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Libvirt-Enable support diskcard option for disk device ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/libvirt-disk-discard-option Most SCSI devices have supported UNMAP command which is used to return unused or freed blocks back to the storage. And ATA devices have a similar command called "Trim" command. This blueprint is aim to support setting discard option for instance's disk. If discard option is "on", unused/freed blocks can be return back to the storage device. Qemu1.5 has supported setting discard option for the raw disk. In Qemu1.6, qcow2 file supported discad option too. Problem description =================== 1. thin provision volume When we write data to a thin provision volume, storage device will allocate blocks to it and it will become bigger. But without discard option supported, the blocks will not be freed to the storage device even if we deleted the data in the volume. The result is the thin volume can become big, but can't become small. With discard option supported, when user deleted the data in the volume, the blocks will be freed to the storage device. The volume will become to small. It's useful for both ephemeral volume and cinder volume. 2. SSD backed volume Free the unused blocks to the SSD storage is useful to impoving the performance and prolonging the liftime of SSD. Proposed change =============== Support the user to specify the discard metadata for the volume or the image. For example: " hw_disk_discard=unmap #enable discard hw_disk_discard=ignore #disable discard, by default " For a volume which have the discard option, nova will produce the xml with a discard property when the volume is attached to an instance. Alternatives ------------ Implement the discard option as a core property of the volume or image. Refer to other implement of the cinder and image, it's better to implement by metadata. And discard option is not like a core property. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- boh.ricky Work Items ---------- * Libvirt driver will create a discard option for a disk device which has the dicard metadata. Dependencies ============ Libvirt(1.0.6) Qemu1.5(raw format) Qemu1.6(qcow2 format) Testing ======= None Documentation Impact ==================== The documentation should be modified to reflect this new feature. References ========== None

commit_message:
Sahara: minor changes for API tests

In file "test_cluster_templates.py" setUpClass method needs
to be wrapped in decorator "safe_setup" because resource
(node group template) is created in setUpClass method.

In addition small code refactoring in tests for data sources was made.

Partially implements: blueprint savanna-api-tests

Change-Id: If783df527fc23ea197c5344a67e1aa3e82774b2c

commit_message:
Rename climatenova to blazarnova

blazarnova (was) an alias package to climatenova, swapping the two so that
climatenova is now the alias package

Change-Id: I25b5d194cdf125c2cc5d4e8c43ceb79e5a80908b

subject: Make the seed default to NODE_* sizes.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-02 01:58:54.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_testenv.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator/commit/21930dd0ffce4796bee3b5f51a9bec5904733440', 'message': "Make the seed default to NODE_* sizes.

The seed has the same memory and CPU needs as an undercloud, and we're
breaking on 2G VMs with amd64 - because the seed hasn't been scaled
consistently.

Change-Id: I78e607f447aae89555b2169551e55ef787855038
"}]
commit_message:
Make the seed default to NODE_* sizes.

The seed has the same memory and CPU needs as an undercloud, and we're
breaking on 2G VMs with amd64 - because the seed hasn't been scaled
consistently.

Change-Id: I78e607f447aae89555b2169551e55ef787855038
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/52/104052/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ## SEED_MEM (MB). It defaults to the NODE_CPU and NODE_MEM values, since ## the seed is equivalent to an undercloud in resource requirements.SEED_CPU=${SEED_CPU:-${NODE_CPU}} SEED_MEM=${SEED_MEM:-${NODE_MEM}}setup-seed-vm $SEED_ARGS -c ${SEED_CPU} -m $((1024 * ${SEED_MEM}))
deleted_lines: ## SEED_MEM (MB)setup-seed-vm $SEED_ARGS -c ${SEED_CPU:-1} -m $((1024 * ${SEED_MEM:-2048}))

added_lines: all involved services, and builds a tree of calls (see an**The scope of this library is quite different:** * We should be able to keep it turned on in lazy mode in production (e.g. admin should be able to "trace" on request)* **How profiler works?** that just calls profiler.start() & profiler.stop() methods. & profiler.stop(). So every trace point crates 2 records in collector. *(more about collector & records later)* * There is a support of nested trace points. Sample below, works and will produce 2 trace points: Having (pranet_id, id) from all trace points is enough to build a tree of nested trace points. Trace points are contains 2 messages (start and stop). These messages are send to collector: * base_id - <uuid> that is equal for all trace points that belongs * parent_id - <uuid> of parent trace point * trace_id - <uuid> of current trace point profiler start() & stop() methods. f.write(json.dumps(info)) If profiler is not initialized, all calls of **profiler.start()** and **profiler.stop()** will be ignored. Initialization is quite simple procedure. **base_id** and **trace_id** will be used to initialize trace_stack in* **What we should use as centralized collector*** **How to initialize profiler, to get one trace cross all services** In case of OpenStack there are 2 kinds interaction between 2 services: Actually the algorithm is a bit more complex. Python client sign trace info with passed to profiler.init HMAC key, and WSGI middleware checks that it's signed with HMAC that is specified in api-paste.ini. So only user that knows HMAC key in api-paste.ini can init properly profiler and send trace info that will be actually processed. RPC calls are used for interaction between services of one project. It's well known that projects are using oslo.messaging to deal with RPC. So the best way to enable cross service tracing (inside of project). Is to add trace info to all messages (in case of inited profiler). And initialize profiler on callee side, if there is a trace info in message.

Trace points are presented in collector as 2 messages (start and stop) * base_id - is <uuid> that is equal for all trace points that belongs * parent_id - is <uuid> that has parent trace point * trace_id - is <uuid> of current trace point profiler start & stop methods. f.write(json.dumps()) If profiler is not initialized, all calls of profiler.start() and profiler.stop() are ignored. Initialization is quite simple. **base_id** and **trace_id** will actually initialize trace_stack in* **What to use as centralized collector*** **How to initialize profiler, to have one trace cross all services** In case of OpenStack there are 2 kinds interaction between to services: Actually the algorithm is a bit more complex. Python client are signed trace info, and WSGI middleware checks that it's signed with HMAC that is specified in api-paste.ini. So only user that knows HMAC key in api-paste.ini can init properly profiler and send trace info that will be actually processed. RPC calls are used for interaction between services of one project. As we all known for RPC projects are using oslo.messaging. So the best way to enable cross service tracing (inside on project). Is to add trace info to all messages (if profiler is inited). And initialize profiler on callee side.

commit_message:
Add test for compute API os-quota-class-sets

This tests showing and updating the 'default' quota class, which is
really all this API is used for. It was removed in Icehouse in part to
not knowing it was used even though python-novaclient and Horizon were
using it. The removal was reverted and this change is to enforce what
the API is used for.

The extension only lives in the Nova v2 API, it was removed in the v3
API in Icehouse.

This change adds new quota client and test classes for the new API.

An external lock fixture is used in all compute API quota tests to
avoid introducing race bugs with the existing tenant-specific
os-quota-sets tests.

Closes-Bug: #1325727

Change-Id: Ib0cde08dfaa0f6a5e180d247864fb59d76eca903
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/42/100342/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six from testtools import matchers from tempest.common import tempest_fixtures as fixtures cls.useFixture(fixtures.LockFixture('compute_quotas')) class QuotaClassesAdminTestJSON(base.BaseV2ComputeAdminTest): """Tests the os-quota-class-sets API to update default quotas. """ @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): # All test cases in this class need to externally lock on doing # anything with default quota values. # TODO(mriedem): does this need to be in setUp or is setUpClass OK? cls.useFixture(fixtures.LockFixture('compute_quotas')) super(QuotaClassesAdminTestJSON, cls).setUpClass() cls.adm_client = cls.os_adm.quota_classes_client @test.attr(type='gate') def test_update_default_quotas(self): # 1. get the current 'default' quota class values resp, body = self.adm_client.get_quota_class_set('default') self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertIn('id', body) self.assertEqual('default', body.pop('id')) # 2. restore the defaults when the test is done original_defaults = body.copy() self.addCleanup(self.adm_client.update_quota_class_set, 'default', **original_defaults) # 3. increment all of the values for updating the default quota class for quota, default in six.iteritems(body): body[quota] = default + 1 # 4. update limits for the default quota class set resp, update_body = self.adm_client.update_quota_class_set('default', **body) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) # 5. assert that the response has all of the changed values self.assertThat(update_body, matchers.MatchesDict(body)) # TODO(mriedem): enable this when the xml client is available # class QuotaClassesAdminTestXML(QuotaClassesAdminTestJSON): # _interface = 'xml'

commit_message:
lbaas basic - open firewall for http on vip port

This is necessary for test_load_balancer_basic to work
when the linuxbridge agent is used.

Change-Id: I620882c31461d438add0f011cb916e28e2f266a3

Gerrit is the review system used in the OpenStack projects. We're sorry, but we won't be able to respond to pull requests submitted through GitHub. Bugs should be filed [on Launchpad](https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-swiftclient), not in GitHub's issue tracker.

Log Trove API errors on databases tabs

commit_message:
Improve cinder CLI existing tests

Objective of this patch to parse the output of read only cinder CLI's,
to validate the output and improve more output verification.
It is improving the code of all below read only cinder CLI's subcommands:
1. backup-list
2. extra-specs-list
3. list
4. rate-limits
5. snapshot-list
6. type-list
7. credentials
8. availability-zone-list
9. endpoints
10. service-list
11. transfer-list
12. qos-list
13. encryption-type-list

Partially implements: blueprint cli-tests-coverage

Change-Id: I3fbbc44194898b9a699a9807a7a800e9a9cb925d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/94/101694/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: backup_list = self.parser.listing(self.cinder('backup-list')) self.assertTableStruct(backup_list, ['ID', 'Volume ID', 'Status', 'Name', 'Size', 'Object Count', 'Container']) extra_specs_list = self.parser.listing(self.cinder('extra-specs-list')) self.assertTableStruct(extra_specs_list, ['ID', 'Name', 'extra_specs']) list = self.parser.listing(self.cinder('list')) self.assertTableStruct(list, ['ID', 'Status', 'Name', 'Size', 'Volume Type', 'Bootable', 'Attached to']) rate_limits = self.parser.listing(self.cinder('rate-limits')) self.assertTableStruct(rate_limits, ['Verb', 'URI', 'Value', 'Remain', 'Unit', 'Next_Available']) snapshot_list = self.parser.listing(self.cinder('snapshot-list')) self.assertTableStruct(snapshot_list, ['ID', 'Volume ID', 'Status', 'Name', 'Size']) type_list = self.parser.listing(self.cinder('type-list')) self.assertTableStruct(type_list, ['ID', 'Name']) credentials = self.parser.listing(self.cinder('credentials')) self.assertTableStruct(credentials, ['User Credentials', 'Value']) zone_list = self.parser.listing(self.cinder('availability-zone-list')) self.assertTableStruct(zone_list, ['Name', 'Status']) endpoints = self.parser.listing(self.cinder('endpoints')) self.assertTableStruct(endpoints, ['nova', 'Value']) service_list = self.parser.listing(self.cinder('service-list')) self.assertTableStruct(service_list, ['Binary', 'Host', 'Zone', 'Status', 'State', 'Updated_at', 'Disabled Reason']) transfer_list = self.parser.listing(self.cinder('transfer-list')) self.assertTableStruct(transfer_list, ['ID', 'Volume ID', 'Name']) qos_list = self.parser.listing(self.cinder('qos-list')) self.assertTableStruct(qos_list, ['ID', 'Name', 'Consumer', 'specs']) encrypt_list = self.parser.listing(self.cinder('encryption-type-list')) self.assertTableStruct(encrypt_list, ['Volume Type ID', 'Provider', 'Cipher', 'Key Size', 'Control Location'])
deleted_lines: self.cinder('backup-list') self.cinder('extra-specs-list') self.cinder('list') self.cinder('rate-limits') self.cinder('snapshot-list') self.cinder('type-list') self.cinder('list-extensions') self.cinder('credentials') self.cinder('availability-zone-list') self.cinder('endpoints') self.cinder('service-list') self.cinder('transfer-list') self.cinder('qos-list') self.cinder('encryption-type-list')

Set management interface to eth1

Set management interface to eth1 instead of eth0 which clashed with the
public network interface of the compute node.

commit_message:
Remove solum from the projects list

Ideally we want to be here, but we need to depend on
mistralclient, which is not in the global requirements
(and unlikely to get there until it's integrated afaik).

This will give us access to pypi.python.org but we will
lose the automatic updates to our requiremnts.txt which
is unfortunate.

Change-Id: Ifecff2254a8bc9e83a54869312053fdad8a51c34

added_lines: import mock from openstack import exceptions class FakeResponse: def __init__(self, response): self.body = response class TestFind(base.TestCase): NAME = 'matrix' ID = 'Fishburne' def setUp(self): super(TestFind, self).setUp() self.mock_session = mock.Mock() self.mock_get = mock.Mock() self.mock_session.get = self.mock_get self.matrix = {'id': self.ID} def test_name(self): self.mock_get.side_effect = [ FakeResponse({FakeResource.resources_key: []}), FakeResponse({FakeResource.resources_key: [self.matrix]}) ] result = FakeResource.find(self.mock_session, self.NAME) self.assertEqual(self.ID, result.id) p = {'fields': 'id', 'name': self.NAME} self.mock_get.assert_called_with('/fakes', params=p, service=None) def test_id(self): resp = FakeResponse({FakeResource.resources_key: [self.matrix]}) self.mock_get.return_value = resp result = FakeResource.find(self.mock_session, self.ID) self.assertEqual(self.ID, result.id) p = {'fields': 'id', 'id': self.ID} self.mock_get.assert_called_with('/fakes', params=p, service=None) def test_nameo(self): self.mock_get.side_effect = [ FakeResponse({FakeResource.resources_key: []}), FakeResponse({FakeResource.resources_key: [self.matrix]}) ] FakeResource.name_attribute = 'nameo' result = FakeResource.find(self.mock_session, self.NAME) FakeResource.name_attribute = 'name' self.assertEqual(self.ID, result.id) p = {'fields': 'id', 'nameo': self.NAME} self.mock_get.assert_called_with('/fakes', params=p, service=None) def test_dups(self): dup = {'id': 'Larry'} resp = FakeResponse({FakeResource.resources_key: [self.matrix, dup]}) self.mock_get.return_value = resp self.assertRaises(exceptions.ResourceDuplicate, FakeResource.find, self.mock_session, self.NAME) def test_nada(self): resp = FakeResponse({FakeResource.resources_key: []}) self.mock_get.return_value = resp self.assertRaises(exceptions.ResourceNotFound, FakeResource.find, self.mock_session, self.NAME)

subject: Fix host option isn't set when using multiple backend
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-23 04:08:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/3539986c4067ac5f36a3c40c03f1624466b2bb2c', 'message': "Fix host option not found exception when using multiple backend

When using multiple volume backend, and volume driver is
cinder.volume.drivers.block_device.BlockDeviceDriver, an exception
raised says host option isn't defined. This patch changes to use
self.host instead of self.configuration.host which isn't registered
before use.

Change-Id: Ide34ed29adad14b778b1a7388e9dc313241fa243
Closes-Bug: 1332909

commit_message:
Fix host option isn't set when using multiple backend

When using multiple volume backend, and volume driver is
cinder.volume.drivers.block_device.BlockDeviceDriver, host
option isn't set so a call to get volumes of a host returns none,
This patch changes to use self.host instead of self.configuration.host

Change-Id: Ide34ed29adad14b778b1a7388e9dc313241fa243
Closes-Bug: 1332909
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/94/101794/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.host)
deleted_lines: self.configuration.host)

commit_message:
Verify "get a server" API response attributes

Now most attributes of Nova v2/v3 APIs are not checked in Tempest,
and this patch adds some tests which check these attributes to block
the backward incompatibility change in the future.

This patch adds the checks of "get a server" API responses.

The response body of v2 API is the following:
  {
    "server": {
      "id": "c2f2ebe8-5a25-442b-83d2-9f0926a7a88a",
      "name": "vm01-v3",
      "status": "ACTIVE",
      "image": {
        "id": "b62655db-2ff7-4d7f-8821-d0a468a25bec",
        "links": [{"href": "http://[..]", "rel": "bookmark"}]
      },
      "flavor": {
        "id": "42",
        "links": [{"href": "http://[..]", "rel": "bookmark"}]
      },
      "user_id": "832ebd066fb0427ea77c4aab6bab5ec1",
      "tenant_id": "b8d8f3df596b482e93c4225b1d72d2c2",
      "created": "2014-03-13T00:40:21Z",
      "updated": "2014-03-13T00:40:31Z",
      "metadata": {},
      "links": [
        {"href": "http://[..]", "rel": "self"},
        {"href": "http://[..]", "rel": "bookmark"}
      ],
      "addresses": {
        "private": [{
          "OS-EXT-IPS-MAC:mac_addr": "fa:16:3e:5f:c3:0f",
          "version": 4, "addr": "10.0.0.5", "OS-EXT-IPS:type": "fixed"
        }]
      },
      "key_name": null,
      "hostId": "6efdef81d6341b7fac789263e366cdf3ed5136f5894db8a2b79d1bc7",
      "progress": 0,
      "OS-SRV-USG:launched_at": "2014-03-13T00:40:31.000000",
      "OS-SRV-USG:terminated_at": null,
      "OS-EXT-AZ:availability_zone": "nova",

      "OS-EXT-STS:task_state": null,
      "OS-EXT-STS:vm_state": "active",
      "OS-EXT-STS:power_state": 1,

      "OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host": "localhost-dev",
      "OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:instance_name": "instance-0000004a",
      "OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:hypervisor_hostname": "localhost-dev",

      "os-extended-volumes:volumes_attached": [],
      "accessIPv4": "",
      "accessIPv6": "",
      "config_drive": "",
      "OS-DCF:diskConfig": "MANUAL"
    }
  }

The one of v3 API is the following:
  {
    "server": {
      "id": "c2f2ebe8-5a25-442b-83d2-9f0926a7a88a",
      "name": "vm01-v3",
      "status": "ACTIVE",
      "image": {
        "id": "b62655db-2ff7-4d7f-8821-d0a468a25bec",
        "links": [{"href": "http://[..]", "rel": "bookmark"}]
      },
      "flavor": {
        "id": "42", "links": [{"href": "http://192.168.11.100:8774/flavors/42", "rel": "bookmark"}]
      },
      "user_id": "832ebd066fb0427ea77c4aab6bab5ec1",
      "tenant_id": "b8d8f3df596b482e93c4225b1d72d2c2",
      "created": "2014-03-13T00:40:21Z",

      "metadata": {},

      ],

subject: Nova times out to boot from volume with larger image
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-08 06:44:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b851f59d744193056f30b54523ce1bd0275f1261', 'message': 'Nova times out to boot from volume with larger image

For larger images, nova is timing out to boot an
instance from the volume. To fix it, block device
mapping logic is updated to iterate for 7200 times
in 1 seconds intervals. 7200 is choosen as this is
the maximum time out for image transfer configured
in cinder,

Fixes bug 1316556

Change-Id: I9a4bbb2f17c7f8e0e5a4adfd812d0849c577962b
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-05-08 08:35:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6bfed8620b0b44016082d5fdd90ad9f92d2046a5', 'message': 'Nova times out to boot from volume with larger image

For larger images, nova is timing out to boot an
instance from the volume. To fix it, block device
mapping logic is updated to iterate for 7200 times
in 1 seconds intervals. 7200 is choosen as this is
the maximum time out for image transfer configured
in cinder,

Fixes bug 1316556

Change-Id: I9a4bbb2f17c7f8e0e5a4adfd812d0849c577962b
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-05-21 07:14:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/57be60664e93fc4f55fd3c7fa10242f7bf67fc53', 'message': 'Nova times out to boot from volume with larger image

For larger images, nova is timing out to boot an
instance from the volume. To fix it, block device
mapping logic is updated to iterate for 7200 times
in 1 seconds intervals. 7200 is choosen as this is
the maximum time out for image transfer configured
in cinder,

/etc/nova/nova.conf is updated with variable
block_device_mapping_wait_timeout - The maximum
timeout in seconds for volume creation, while
instance is booted from volume.

Close-bug: #1316556

Change-Id: I9a4bbb2f17c7f8e0e5a4adfd812d0849c577962b

commit_message:
Nova times out to boot from volume with larger image

For larger images, nova is timing out to boot an
instance from the volume. To fix it, block device
mapping logic is updated to make the timeout value
as configurable from nova.conf. By default its
set to 180 seconds as earlier.

DocImpact
/etc/nova/nova.conf is updated with following
variables:
block_device_mapping_timeout - Maximum number of
seconds to wail for volume creation, while
instance is booted from volume.
block_device_mapping_polling_interval - Number
of seconds to poll for volume creation while
instance is booted from volume

Closes-bug: #1316556

Change-Id: I9a4bbb2f17c7f8e0e5a4adfd812d0849c577962b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/82/92782/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: block_device_mapping_opts = [ #vmware_image_transfer_timeout_secs is configured to 7200 #by default in cinder, This is the maximum timeout used cfg.IntOpt('block_device_mapping_maximum_iteration', default=7200, help=('The number of iterations to poll for volume creation ' ',while instance is booted from volume.')), cfg.IntOpt('block_device_mapping_polling_interval', default=1, help=('The polling interval in seconds for volume creation ' ',while instance is booted from volume.')), ] CONF.register_opts(block_device_mapping_opts) def _await_block_device_map_created(self, context, vol_id, max_tries=CONF.block_device_mapping_maximum_iteration, wait_between=CONF.block_device_mapping_polling_interval):
deleted_lines: def _await_block_device_map_created(self, context, vol_id, max_tries=180, wait_between=1): # TODO(harlowja): make the max_tries configurable or dynamic?

commit_message:
Added VirtProperties::NovaObject

The new object represents 'properties' from glance image
metadata.  Only the properties predefined in VirtProperties
can now be used by Libvirt driver.

Change-Id: Ib5c906865c672fe30191adcae6317fe10bc569aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/09/104709/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.objects import virt_properties as virt_properties_obj virt_props = virt_properties_obj.VirtProperties.from_image_metadata( image_meta) if virt_props.obj_attr_is_set('hw_architecture'): arch = virt_props.hw_architecture if arch is not None: return arch
deleted_lines: arch = image_meta.get('properties', {}).get('architecture') if arch is not None: return arch

commit_message:
Add support for HEAD requests of resources

Allow Resource.head* to make HEAD requests. When header data comes back,
X-Trans-Id headers are converted into 'id' data to match the rest of
the response types, and to match Resource.id attribute access.

Change-Id: I6d898f0734bbdbcb02b79d3387ee8248e401a36e

commit_message:
Handle 'HTTPNotFound' in scenario tests cleanup

In tempest/scenario/manager.py ->is_deletion_complete(),
exception 'HTTPNotFound' is not handled.

This function should return true when exception 'NotFound' or
'HTTPNotFound' is caught from get resource. Some client like
glance through 'HTTPNotFound' exception if resource is not found.

Change-Id: I48f4c0b592c045f82bee1372516fb3f6cdd3eb86
Closes-Bug: #1337104
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/58/104458/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: if e.__class__.__name__ == 'NotFound':

commit_message:
Make test_drivers.py use driver name from conf

test_list_drivers and test_show_driver in test_drivers.py use hard_coded
driver name.
This patch make these tests use driver name which is written in config file.

Closes-Bug: #1317717

Change-Id: Idad4c496a42c9253548fdf9020ffb8013fef951f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/96/92996/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest import configCONF = config.CONF driver_name = CONF.baremetal.driver self.assertIn(driver_name, [d['name'] for d in drivers['drivers']]) driver_name = CONF.baremetal.driver
deleted_lines: self.assertIn('fake', [d['name'] for d in drivers['drivers']]) driver_name = 'fake'

commit_message:
Mock time for audit test 'test_sleeper'

The object auditor unit test, test_sleeper, needs to mock out time
to ensure run variations in the test environment do not skew the
results.

Change-Id: I6ef15e88d6f760bc805e4bb6a6270751984624ff
Closes-Bug: 1321019
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/38/98538/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: with mock.patch( 'time.time', mock.MagicMock()) as mock_sleep: auditor.SLEEP_BETWEEN_AUDITS = 0.10 my_auditor = auditor.ObjectAuditor(self.conf) my_auditor._sleep() mock_sleep.sleep(auditor.SLEEP_BETWEEN_AUDITS)
deleted_lines: auditor.SLEEP_BETWEEN_AUDITS = 0.10 my_auditor = auditor.ObjectAuditor(self.conf) start = time.time() my_auditor._sleep() delta_t = time.time() - start self.assert_(delta_t > 0.08) self.assert_(delta_t < 0.12)

subject: Fix issues with test_wsgi.py and Storage Policies
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-23 23:05:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/890eb661cb7640d442a4d1ebbbbe8eea41fcd7fe', 'message': 'Fix issues with test_wsgi.py and Storage Policies

- a few funcs were missing @patch_policies and could puke if the
local swift.conf included something other than what was hard coded
in _fake_rings() (just 2 policies)
- test_loadapp_proxy() needed to be updated to account for the
fact that the ring serialized_path() method will return the path for
swift_dir in the proxy app as opposed to what it was doing before
(creating an obj ring in a new tmpdir then asserting that this path
would match the one returned from serialized_path())

Change-Id: Ia706000ba961ed24f2c22b81041e53a0c3f302fc
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-24 06:13:50.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/test_internal_client.py', 'test/unit/__init__.py', 'test/unit/common/test_wsgi.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/441a171cf5dd8eb61601a0dbdd2835c10ca27245', 'message': "Fix issues with test_wsgi.py and Storage Policies

Discovered some tests that were coupling the code under test with the
storage policies configured in /etc/swift/swift.conf.  There was some
tests that created fake rings in their tempdirs, but didn't reset or
patch the POLICIES global.  So if your local config needed more rings
that the fake's were setting up (just 2) the tests would puke when they
loaded up an app that looked for rings.  I think this probably started
happening when we added eager object ring loading back into the proxy.

 * two TestCases in test_wsgi were missing @patch_policies
 * fixed issue with patch_policies that could cause state to bleed
   between tests
 * patch_policies' legacy and default collections get a FakeRing by
   default

 * drive-by cleanup for test_loadapp_proxy() ring serialized path
   handling
 * drive-by cleanup for test_internal_client that was doing basically
   the same thing as test_wsgi

Change-Id: Ia706000ba961ed24f2c22b81041e53a0c3f302fc
"}]
commit_message:
Fix issues with test_wsgi.py and Storage Policies

Discovered some tests that were coupling the code under test with the
storage policies configured in /etc/swift/swift.conf.  There was some
tests that created fake rings in their tempdirs, but didn't reset or
patch the POLICIES global.  So if your local config needed more rings
that the fake's were setting up (just 2) the tests would puke when they
loaded up an app that looked for rings.  I think this probably started
happening when we added eager object ring loading back into the proxy.

 * two TestCases in test_wsgi were missing @patch_policies
 * fixed issue with patch_policies that could cause state to bleed
   between tests
 * patch_policies' legacy and default collections get a FakeRing by
   default

 * drive-by cleanup for test_loadapp_proxy() ring serialized path
   handling
 * drive-by cleanup for test_internal_client that was doing basically
   the same thing as test_wsgi

Change-Id: Ia706000ba961ed24f2c22b81041e53a0c3f302fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/52/102052/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from swift.common.storage_policy import POLICIES@patch_policies for policy in POLICIES: os.path.join(tmpdir, policy.ring_name + '.ring.gz')@patch_policies@patch_policies _fake_rings(tempdir) object_ring_list = [] for policy in POLICIES: # clear out the rings or they won't reload with the right dir policy.object_ring = None object_ring_list.append(os.path.join(tempdir, policy.ring_name) + '.ring.gz') for policy in POLICIES: self.assert_(proxy_app.get_object_ring(policy.idx).serialized_path in object_ring_list)

commit_message:
Implements: blueprint FWaaS extension for customized service and service group
In FWaaS, administrator can use port range and protocol inside firewall rules
to define traffic type. But we don't have a flexible way to allow user to specify more
than one type of traffic in the same rule.To support different traffic type, with the
same source, destination address and action, different rules need to be created.
This makes the process of defining firewall rules un-scalable.

two resources are added to enhance the FWaaS using the following cli
one is called service group and one is called service object
Administrator can use service object to define a special type of traffic. The service
objects is grouped into service group that can be referenced from other openstack
modules (eg. firewall rule).
Each service object can be defined with a timeout value that can be used to overwrite
default session idle timeout value.

New CLIs:
service-group-create
service-group-delete
service-group-list
service-group-show
service-group-update
service-object-create
service-object-delete
service-object-list
service-object-show

Change-Id: I3e8f73203033c0f41b24393b4add990bf8ad84fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/26/104426/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutronclient.neutron.v2_0 import servicegroup 'service-group-create': servicegroup.CreateServiceGroup, 'service-group-show': servicegroup.ShowServiceGroup, 'service-group-list': servicegroup.ListServiceGroup, 'service-group-delete': servicegroup.DeleteServiceGroup, 'service-group-update': servicegroup.UpdateServiceGroup, 'service-object-create': servicegroup.CreateServiceObject, 'service-object-list': servicegroup.ListServiceObject, 'service-object-show': servicegroup.ShowServiceObject, 'service-object-delete': servicegroup.DeleteServiceObject, self.log.debug(_('Got an error: %s'), unicode(err))
deleted_lines: self.log.debug('Got an error: %s', unicode(err))

But we don't have a flexible way to allow user to specify more than one type of traffic in the same rule.To support different traffic type, with the same source, destination address and action, different rules need to be created. This makes the process of defining firewall rules un-scalable.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-03 03:06:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c990b1abcedc9f18bf029aac76393f385602b237', 'message': 'Implements: blueprint FWaaS extension for customized service and service group

two resources are added to the db
one is called service group(class ServiceGroup) and one is called service object(class ServiceObject)
class ServiceGroupDbMixin is mixin lcass to add service group to db plugin base,
service group id is added to class firewall rule and the corresponding dict
reference implementation support is not yet complete and will be fully done in next patch.
the agent queries the service group content from plugin	and expend the firewal rule based on the
content of the service group into the iptable rules.
Administrator can use service object to define a special type of traffic. The service
objects is grouped into service group that can be referenced from other openstack
modules (eg. firewall rule).
Each service object can be defined with a timeout value that can be used to overwrite
default session idle timeout value.

Data model impact
-----------------

Firewall rules:

+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+
| Attribute name    |  Type      | Default Value   | Required  | CRUD | Description             |
+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+
| service_groups    | List       |  empty          | N         | CRU  | List of service groups  |
+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+

Service group:

+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+
| Attribute name    |  Type      | Default Value   | Required  | CRUD | Description             |
+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+
| id                | uuid       |  generated      | Y         |  R   |                         |
+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+
| name              | String     |  empty          | N         | CRU  |Name of service group    |
+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+
| description       | String     |  empty          | N         | CRU  |                         |
+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+
| tenant id         | uuid       |  empty          | Y         | R    |Id of tenant that creates|
|                   |            |                 |           |      |service group            |
+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+
| service objects   | list       |  empty list     | N         | CRU  |List of service objects  |
+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+

Service object:

+----------------------+----------------+-----------------------------+------+--------------------------+
| Attribute name       | Type           | Default Value   | Required  | CRUD |Description               |
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| id                   | uuid           |  generated      | Y         | R    |                          |
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| name                 | String         |  empty          | N         | CRU  |Service object name       |
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| service group id     | uuid           |  empty          | N         | CRU  |Foreign key to service grp|
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| protocol             | string         |  empty          | Y         | CRU  |'tcp','udp','icmp','any'  |
|                      |                |                 |           |      | or protocol id (0-255)   |
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| source_port          | integer or str |  empty          | N         | CRU  |This could be either a    |
|                      |                |                 |           |      |single port (integer or   |
|                      |                |                 |           |      |string) or a range(string)|
|                      |                |                 |           |      |in the form "p1:p2"       |

+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| destination_port     |integer or str  |  empty          | N         | CRU  | Same as source_port      |
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| icmp_code            | char           |  empty          | N         | CRU  |                          |
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| icmp_type            | char           |  empty          | N         | CRU  |                          |
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| timeout              | short          |  empty          | N         | CRU  |                          |
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| tenant_id            | uuid           |  empty          | Y         | R    |                          |
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+

Change-Id: Idf247324d39288335de476ba51e8fb8123332ebe

commit_message:
Implements: blueprint FWaaS extension for customized service and service group
In FWaaS, administrator can use port range and protocol inside firewall rules
to define traffic type. But we don't have a flexible way to allow user to specify more
than one type of traffic in the same rule.To support different traffic type, with the
same source, destination address and action, different rules need to be created.
This makes the process of defining firewall rules un-scalable.

two resources are added to the db
one is called service group(class ServiceGroup) and one is called service object(class ServiceObject)
class ServiceGroupDbMixin is mixin lcass to add service group to db plugin base,
service group id is added to class firewall rule and the corresponding dict
reference implementation support is not yet complete and will be fully done in next patch.
the agent queries the service group content from plugin	and expend the firewal rule based on the
content of the service group into the iptable rules.
Administrator can use service object to define a special type of traffic. The service
objects is grouped into service group that can be referenced from other openstack
modules (eg. firewall rule).
Each service object can be defined with a timeout value that can be used to overwrite
default session idle timeout value.

Data model impact
-----------------

Firewall rules:

+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+
| Attribute name    |  Type      | Default Value   | Required  | CRUD | Description             |
+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+
| service_groups    | List       |  empty          | N         | CRU  | List of service groups  |
+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+

Service group:

+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+
| Attribute name    |  Type      | Default Value   | Required  | CRUD | Description             |
+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+
| id                | uuid       |  generated      | Y         |  R   |                         |
+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+
| name              | String     |  empty          | N         | CRU  |Name of service group    |
+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+
| description       | String     |  empty          | N         | CRU  |                         |
+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+
| tenant id         | uuid       |  empty          | Y         | R    |Id of tenant that creates|
|                   |            |                 |           |      |service group            |
+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+
| service objects   | list       |  empty list     | N         | CRU  |List of service objects  |
+-------------------+------------+-----------------+-----------+------+-------------------------+

Service object:

+----------------------+----------------+-----------------------------+------+--------------------------+
| Attribute name       | Type           | Default Value   | Required  | CRUD |Description               |
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| id                   | uuid           |  generated      | Y         | R    |                          |
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| name                 | String         |  empty          | N         | CRU  |Service object name       |
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| service group id     | uuid           |  empty          | N         | CRU  |Foreign key to service grp|
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| protocol             | string         |  empty          | Y         | CRU  |'tcp','udp','icmp','any'  |
|                      |                |                 |           |      | or protocol id (0-255)   |
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| source_port          | integer or str |  empty          | N         | CRU  |This could be either a    |
|                      |                |                 |           |      |single port (integer or   |
|                      |                |                 |           |      |string) or a range(string)|
|                      |                |                 |           |      |in the form "p1:p2"       |
|                      |                |                 |           |      |where(0<=p1<=p2 <=65535)  |
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| destination_port     |integer or str  |  empty          | N         | CRU  | Same as source_port      |
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| icmp_code            | char           |  empty          | N         | CRU  |                          |
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| icmp_type            | char           |  empty          | N         | CRU  |                          |
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| timeout              | short          |  empty          | N         | CRU  |                          |
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+
| tenant_id            | uuid           |  empty          | Y         | R    |                          |
+----------------------+----------------+-----------------+-----------+------+--------------------------+

same source, destination address and action, different rules need to be created.

commit_message:
Implements: blueprint fwaas-customized-service using service group

-In FWaaS, administrator can use port range and protocol inside firewall rules
to define traffic type. But we don't have a flexible way to allow user to specify more
than one type of traffic in the same rule.To support different traffic type, with the
same source, destination address and action, different rules need to be created.
This makes the process of defining firewall rules un-scalable.
two resources are added to enhance the FWaaS using the following cli
one is called service group and one is called service object
Administrator can use service object to define a special type of traffic. The service
objects is grouped into service group that can be referenced from other openstack
modules (eg. firewall rule).
Each service object can be defined with a timeout value that can be used to overwrite
default session idle timeout value.
New CLIs:
service-group-create
service-group-delete
service-group-list
service-group-show
service-group-update
service-object-create
service-object-delete
service-object-list
service-object-show

Change-Id: Ie703b9e7e96dde16e64498bd598ac439004bfb15
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/02/104702/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutronclient.neutron.v2_0 import servicegroup 'service-group-create': servicegroup.CreateServiceGroup, 'service-group-show': servicegroup.ShowServiceGroup, 'service-group-list': servicegroup.ListServiceGroup, 'service-group-delete': servicegroup.DeleteServiceGroup, 'service-group-update': servicegroup.UpdateServiceGroup, 'service-object-create': servicegroup.CreateServiceObject, 'service-object-list': servicegroup.ListServiceObject, 'service-object-show': servicegroup.ShowServiceObject, 'service-object-delete': servicegroup.DeleteServiceObject, self.log.debug(_('Got an error: %s'), unicode(err))
deleted_lines: self.log.debug('Got an error: %s', unicode(err))

commit_message:
Update nova rebuild to account for new image

Update the Nova driver's rebuild() to account for changes in the instance image
during rebuild.  Currently, rebuild ignores user requests to rebuild with a
new image, making it impossible to do image-based upgrades.  This adds logic
to the patcher to account for the preserve_ephemeral flag and updates rebuild()
to use the patcher to re-patch all driver_info during rebuild.

This also adds missing test coverage of the rebuild code.

Change-Id: I6c8aacd36e0095d0590a1dc552730f2d52036225
Closes-bug: #1334905.

commit_message:
Pass the context when updating raw_templates

Without a context, the raw_template was being stored using a different DB
session, with the result that changes did not end up in the database.

Also, don't use the same raw_template DB entry for the backup stack, since
that causes competing modifications to the DB that break rollback.

Change-Id: I6c71c19acac0b87943f36c57c2300cf2b0478aa3
Closes-Bug: #1331872
Related-Bug: #1291905
Related-Bug: #1206702
Related-Bug: #1328342

commit_message:
trust authentication

This patch enables authenticating by using a trust. The trust ID
must be set with the parameter --os-trust-id or the env variable
OS_TRUST_ID. Trusts are available for the identity v3 API.

Co-Authored-By: Florent Flament <florent.flament@cloudwatt.com>
Change-Id: Iacc389b203bbadda53ca31a7f5a9b8b6e1a1f522

_LC())[1] is problematic because they are not modules. Since the
Openstack guidelines only allow modules to be imported[2], the entire
gettextutils module must imported in order to use the translation

This patch adds all four markers to import_exceptions in tox.ini, so
they can be imported individually without failing the pep8 tests.  This

commit_message:
Add gettextutils._L* to import_exceptions

Using the new logging translation markers (_LI(), _LW(), _LE(),
_LC())[1] is problematic because they are not modules. Since the
Openstack guidelines only allow modules to be imported[2], the entire
gettextutils module must imported in order to use the translation
markers.

This patch adds all four markers to import_exceptions in tox.ini, so
they can be imported individually without failing the pep8 tests.  This
is already done with the _() marker.  With this change, it will be
allowable to import marker functions like so:

from ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils import _LI
from ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils import _LW
from ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils import _LE
from ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils import _LC

[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html
[2]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I78192dd7525624174deb8d377996ed3d61b36a8a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/96/104696/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import_exceptions = ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils._, ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils._LI, ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils._LW,ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils._LE, ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils._LC, testtools.matchers
deleted_lines: import_exceptions = ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils._,testtools.matchers

commit_message:
Capture apache configuration files

Capture the apache vhost files in the output from ds-g. Since we
have more than just horizon's configuration, it is useful to know
how the Apache server is running / errors in the vhost when a
check or gate job finishes.

Change-Id: I1e5a7b5086566c0cbd18dee92c5062773ce8a8e5

added_lines: # Archive Apache config files sudo mkdir $BASE/logs/apache_config if is_ubuntu; then sudo cp /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/* $BASE/logs/apache_config elif is_fedora; then sudo cp /etc/httpd/conf.d/* $BASE/logs/apache_config fi

subject: Fix potential missing key error in container_info
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-03 04:18:29.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj.py', 'test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_base.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/bfa9139649c0ac7f75e8c9503cb04d06f7bae0b9', 'message': 'Fix potential missing key error in container_info

If upgrading from a non-storage policy enabled version of
swift to a storage policy enabled version its possible that
memcached will have an info structure that does not contain
the 'storage_policy" key resulting in an unhandled exception
during the lookup.  The fix is to simply make sure we never
return the dict without a storage_policy key defined; if it
doesn't exist its safe to make it '0' as this means you're

commit_message:
Fix potential missing key error in container_info

If upgrading from a non-storage policy enabled version of
swift to a storage policy enabled version its possible that
memcached will have an info structure that does not contain
the 'storage_policy" key resulting in an unhandled exception
during the lookup.  The fix is to simply make sure we never
return the dict without a storage_policy key defined; if it
doesn't exist its safe to make it '0' as this means you're
in the update scenario and there's xno other possibility.

Change-Id: If8c88f67ba7a3180ad06b586372fe35c65807aac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/42/104442/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: info.setdefault('storage_policy', '0') info.setdefault('storage_policy', '0')

subject: Fix pop_queue for move object twice
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-03 04:18:29.000000000', 'files': ['test/probe/test_container_merge_policy_index.py', 'swift/container/reconciler.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/7dbf8324569d45897f2b4f05cd97299366eff23d', 'message': 'Fix pop_queue for move object twice

With the two vector timestamp change some resolution was lost in the queue
entries that could lead to the reconciler being unable to successfully remove
a processed item from the queue in pop_queue.  To ensure the queue entries
with a significant offset can be successfully removed while still handling
the re-enqueued object case issue the DELETE with the timestamp slightly later
than the maximum of the queue entries last modified time (q_record) and
misplaced objects timestamp (q_ts).

Change-Id: I87b1e4b4256af3f71defb58c8137c303d1ae63be
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pop_queue for move object twice

With the two vector timestamp change some resolution was lost in the queue
entries that could lead to the reconciler being unable to successfully remove
a processed item from the queue in pop_queue.  To ensure the queue entries
with a significant offset can be successfully removed while still handling
the re-enqueued object case issue the DELETE with the timestamp slightly later
than the maximum of the queue entries last modified time (q_record) and
misplaced objects timestamp (q_ts).

Change-Id: I87b1e4b4256af3f71defb58c8137c303d1ae63be
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/41/104441/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: x_timestamp = slightly_later_timestamp(max(q_record, q_ts))
deleted_lines: x_timestamp = slightly_later_timestamp(q_record)

commit_message:
sync policy logging fix from incubator

This change syncs in a delete of an extremely verbose tight loop
debug message in policy.py that generated 8 additional lines for
every wsgi call.

Changes:

238e601b Make policy debug logging less verbose
9c88dc31 file_open: fixed docstring to refer to open() instead of file()

Change-Id: Ifd3f139ebabec9db4a645cd092a810ab22f5085e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/10/104010/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: see built-in open() documentation for more details return open(*args, **kwargs)
deleted_lines: see built-in file() documentation for more details return file(*args, **kwargs)

subject: ConfigDriveBuilder refactor for tempdir cleanliness
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-30 21:24:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e60562d0f2a96244bb1fe3d7ab372b754dfc0836', 'message': "condense config drive debug logging

Config drive debug logging is happening in a tight inner loop, so
you end up getting 8 DEBUG lines (1 per file) for every time config
drive is inflated. Instead log once about all the files that were
added. If something goes wrong, we'll get the exception, so the
possible loss of information is negligible.

Change-Id: I1aaf194fef00edd6eecf73b5bb9323e0e3a6f09f
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-01 11:49:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_configdrive2.py', 'nova/virt/configdrive.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6e15d787fffcef8c4299fbaf1d5c715af1a34fa2', 'message': "ConfigDriveBuilder refactor for tempdir cleanliness

In looking to clean up excessive DEBUG logging, it became clear
that the logging in ConfigDriveBuilder was largely based on the
split logic that existed in doing fs opts in __init__ and then
also later in make_drive. This required a persistent tempdir, which
had to be manually cleaned up. It also meant a mandatory additional
config variable.

Refactor ConfigDriveBuilder to move all fs opts into make_drive,
deprecating the config variable in the process. In doing so, I don't
believe the previous debug logging is useful any more. However, in
case, add a __repr__ for ConfigDriveBuilder that will provide us with
a reasonable debug representation in case this becomes part of what
gets thrown.

Tests are now adjusted to not call private methods, but instead call
make_drive with config variable set.

Change-Id: I1aaf194fef00edd6eecf73b5bb9323e0e3a6f09f
"}]
commit_message:
ConfigDriveBuilder refactor for tempdir cleanliness

In looking to clean up excessive DEBUG logging, it became clear
that the logging in ConfigDriveBuilder was largely based on the
split logic that existed in doing fs opts in __init__ and then
also later in make_drive. This required a persistent tempdir, which
had to be manually cleaned up. It also meant a mandatory additional
config variable.

Refactor ConfigDriveBuilder to move all fs opts into make_drive,
deprecating the config variable in the process. In doing so, I don't
believe the previous debug logging is useful any more. However, in
case, add a __repr__ for ConfigDriveBuilder that will provide us with
a reasonable debug representation in case this becomes part of what
gets thrown.

Tests are now adjusted to not call private methods, but instead call
make_drive with config variable set.

Change-Id: I1aaf194fef00edd6eecf73b5bb9323e0e3a6f09f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/63/103663/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: files = [] for (path, value) in instance_md.metadata_for_config_drive(): files.append(path) # NOTE(sdague): debug outside the loop otherwise you get 8+ # debug messages for every config drive inflate LOG.debug('Added files %(files)s to config drive', {'files': ", ".join(files)})
deleted_lines: for (path, value) in instance_md.metadata_for_config_drive(): LOG.debug('Added %(filepath)s to config drive', {'filepath': path})

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-09 20:06:36.000000000', 'files': ['test/functional/__init__.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/89cb0f6636236da644a53d4a0c4833a120150a35', 'message': "Drop use_hub() from functests

commit_message:
Drop use_hub() from functests

When Peter cargo-culted this part from wsgi.py, I consulted Mike
about its origins. Apparently, it was a workaround for a rare
error condition with epoll, which may not even apply anymore,
but nobody dares to risk trying to remove it. IMHO we shold at
least not copy it around any more than necessary.

If we ever see an in-process functest hanging with a lost event,
we should use use_hub('selects') here and not the trickery from
the utils, IMHO again.

Change-Id: I767a2e76c2b72c7e68022167400f02e72395ce06
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/22/93122/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: eventlet.hubs.use_hub(utils.get_hub())

commit_message:
virt: add get_instance_disk_info to virt driver API

The compute manager has been calling get_instance_disk_info on
virt driver implementations during block migration, despite
this method not being declared in the virt driver API. It was
implemented in libvirt and stubbed in xenapi, with different
API signatures in both.

Declare & document it as part of the virt driver API, and
split the libvirt impl into two parts to hide the libvirt
specific notion of XML config.

Partial-bug: #1333219
Change-Id: I38c811f91cce99772ff988a278c32483a219949d

deleted_lines: self.mox.StubOutWithMock(conn, 'get_instance_disk_info') conn.get_instance_disk_info(instance["name"], dummyxml, conn.get_instance_disk_info = _check_xml_bus def get_info(instance_name): def fake_get_instance_disk_info(instance, xml=None, def fake_get_instance_disk_info(instance, xml=None,

subject: Fix KeyError on Storage Policy Container Sync
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-03 04:18:29.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/unit/__init__.py', 'test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/fb5a0f21ddfde12f503c4a7048d8b8ca1c2724ef', 'message': "Fix KeyError on Storage Policy Container Sync

In the proxy, container_info can return a 'storage_policy' of None.  When
you set a header value on a swob.Request to None that effectively just
delete's the key.  One path through the proxy during container sync was
counting on the the 'X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index' being set which isn't
the case if the cached container_info if for a pre-policies container.

Also clean up some test cruft, tighten up the interface on FakeConn, and add
some object controller tests to exercise more interesting failure and handoff
code paths.

Change-Id: I643e08c208efdc5a39e840d9e96710ddad54236b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix KeyError on Storage Policy Container Sync

In the proxy, container_info can return a 'storage_policy' of None.  When
you set a header value on a swob.Request to None that effectively just
delete's the key.  One path through the proxy during container sync was
counting on the the 'X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index' being set which isn't
the case if the cached container_info if for a pre-policies container.

Also clean up some test cruft, tighten up the interface on FakeConn, and add
some object controller tests to exercise more interesting failure and handoff
code paths.

commit_message:
Document Filter Scheduler and overcommit ratio

Terminology: add "Scheduler" and "Overcommit ratio" articles.

User guide: add section with graphic for Settings page where one
can select the older scheduler

Release Notes: add sections for "Filter Scheduler" and "Overcommit ratio"
to 030-other-enhancements

Change-Id: Ie48d69461da1427d31b67f916d5e1a2abed95e91
Closes-Bug: 1333436

The Filter Scheduler is generally superior to the older scheduler and should be used for most environments; use this screen to choose the older scheduler if necessary.

commit_message:
Extra route extension for PLUMgrid plugin

Implements: blueprint plumgrid-plugin-extraroute-extension
Change-Id: I10cecf4ae5bf52047514e04ec7ecd96a3e2cbd8f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/03/104403/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================= Extra route extension support for PLUMgrid Plugin ================================================= Launchpad Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/plumgrid-plugin-extraroute-extension Proposal to add support for extra route extension in PLUMgrid plugin Problem description =================== Currently, PLUMgrid plugin does not support Neutron's extra-route extension. This feature is required to support static routes in PLUMgrid routers. Proposed change =============== Adding extension support code in PLUMgrid plugin Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== PLUMgrid supports adding static routes to PLUMgrid routers which fits nicely with extra route extension supported by Neutron. Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Fawad Khaliq <fawadkhaliq> Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- Extension code in PLUMgrid plugin Unit test coverage in PLUMgrid plugin Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit Test coverage for extra-route extension within PLUMgrid unit tests Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== N/A

commit_message:
horizon_workflow.less could be more less-like

horizon_workflow.less is currently pretty much css.  There's some
semi-sophisticated css in there (the arrows) and it would be improved
with some variable usage and more nesting.

Change-Id: I223b040962169e623b382d7de687f1b199304895
Closes-Bug: 1295847

commit_message:
Handle proposed/ branches in test-matrix.py

We are now cutting proposed/* branches on projects. Test matrix needs to
know about them. Test proposed/foo* as if it were a stable/foo branch
when we know what foo is. If we do not know about foo fallback onto
testing with a master setup as this branch is an intermediate non
integrated release (eg swift proposed/2.0.0) which is released while
other projects are still developing on master.

As part of this change update features.yaml to teach it about juno in
prep for the upcoming juno release.

Change-Id: I3f72d3171d0a1afc00298b1761c06b77bb282a6b

subject: Avoid re-adding iptables rules for instances that have disappeared
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-03 15:14:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/771a5dac0f8b3683882428b78a49b10df6093039', 'message': "Avoid re-adding iptables rules for instances that have disappeared

The remove_filters_for_instance() method fails silently if the
instance's chain is gone (i.e. it's been deleted). If this
happens while we're refreshing security group rules, we will
not notice this case and re-add stale rules for an old instance,
breaking our firewall for new instances.

This adds a quick check after we've captured the lock to see if
the associated chain exists, and bails if it doesn't.

Change-Id: Ic75988939f82de49735d85fe99a9eecd4baf45c9
Related-bug: #1182131
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-03 15:45:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e1c870da312e602ce281a3c0f9b20bc6c5ac59e3', 'message': "Avoid re-adding iptables rules for instances that have disappeared

instance's chain is gone (i.e. it's been deleted). If this
happens while we're refreshing security group rules, we will
not notice this case and re-add stale rules for an old instance,

This adds a quick check after we've captured the lock to see if

Change-Id: Ic75988939f82de49735d85fe99a9eecd4baf45c9
Related-bug: #1182131

commit_message:
Avoid re-adding iptables rules for instances that have disappeared

The remove_filters_for_instance() method fails silently if the
instance's chain is gone (i.e. it's been deleted). If this
happens while we're refreshing security group rules, we will
not notice this case and re-add stale rules for an old instance,
breaking our firewall for new instances.

This adds a quick check after we've captured the lock to see if
the associated chain exists, and bails if it doesn't.

Change-Id: Ic75988939f82de49735d85fe99a9eecd4baf45c9
Related-bug: #1182131
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/81/104581/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: chain_name = self._instance_chain_name(instance) if not self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].has_chain(chain_name): LOG.info( _('instance chain %s disappeared during refresh, ' 'skipping') % chain_name, instance=instance) return

commit_message:
vmwareapi: remove unused update_host_status method

The VMWare driver declares a method 'update_host_status'
which has no callers anywhere in the codebase.

This is left over code that was missed in the cleanup from

  commit 2cb47fbabf09ced76178e8453d508c66f86a7a3a
  Author: Arata Notsu <notsu@virtualtech.jp>
  Date:   Thu Oct 18 22:40:01 2012 +0900

    Remove ComputeDriver.update_host_status()

Partial-bug: #1333219
Change-Id: Ie0de9b6d427246cb3c3adb818d483b61dfb08d82
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/83/101883/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add option to generate_sample.sh to use tox.ini excludes

Adds command line option for generate_sample.sh to exclude paths
found in tox.ini's EXCLUDE= lines.

Change-Id: Ifff7e3336472ff94373b88fa99b7bd4fc37d0705
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/65/78765/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PARSED_OPTIONS=$(getopt -n "${0##*/}" -o hb:p:m:l:o:t: \ --long help,base-dir:,package-name:,output-dir:,module:,library:,usetoxexclude: -- "$@") echo "-t, --usetoxexclude add find excludes for paths found in tox.ixi exclude lines" -t|--usetoxexclude) shift USETOXEXCLUDE="yes" shift ;;EXCLUDEPATHS="-not -path */tests/*" if [ -n $USETOXEXCLUDE ]; then echo "Adding excludes from $BASEDIR/tox.ini" if [ -f $BASEDIR/tox.ini ]; then EXCLUDELINES=`awk -F' = ' '/^exclude/ {print $2}' $BASEDIR/tox.ini` for EXCLUDETMPPATH in ${EXCLUDELINES//,/ }; do if [ -d $EXCLUDETMPPATH ]; then EXCLUDEPATHS+=" -not -path */$EXCLUDETMPPATH/*" fi done else echo "Unable to locate tox.ini." fi fi EXCLUDEPATHS=$(echo "$EXCLUDEPATHS" | sed -e 's#/#\\/#g') FINDCOMMAND='find $TARGETDIR -type f -name "*.py" $EXCLUDEPATHS ' FINDCOMMAND+='-exec grep -l "Opt(" {} + | sed -e "s/^$BASEDIRESC\///g" | sort -u' FILES=`eval $FINDCOMMAND`for mod in ${IRONIC_CONFIG_GENERATOR_EXTRA_MODULES}; dofor lib in ${IRONIC_CONFIG_GENERATOR_EXTRA_LIBRARIES}; doDEFAULT_MODULEPATH=ironic.openstack.common.config.generator
deleted_lines: PARSED_OPTIONS=$(getopt -n "${0##*/}" -o hb:p:m:l:o: \ --long help,base-dir:,package-name:,output-dir:,module:,library: -- "$@")FILES=$(find $TARGETDIR -type f -name "*.py" ! -path "*/tests/*" \ -exec grep -l "Opt(" {} + | sed -e "s/^$BASEDIRESC\///g" | sort -u)for mod in ${OSLO_CONFIG_GENERATOR_EXTRA_MODULES}; dofor lib in ${OSLO_CONFIG_GENERATOR_EXTRA_LIBRARIES}; doDEFAULT_MODULEPATH=openstack.common.config.generator

commit_message:
Use (# of CPUs) glance workers by default

The config docs have historically recommended that the number of
glance  workers should be set to the number of CPUs available for
best performance, so we should make this the default.

Commit 75c96a48fc7e5dfb59d8258142b01422f81b0253 did the same thing in
Nova in Icehouse and the plan is to do the same thing for Cinder
and Trove workers.

The config files are updated to match the help string in the code.

There is no upgrade impact since glance-api.conf previously
hard-coded the workers value to 1 so anyone upgrading to this
will still get whatever value was set in glance-api.conf prior
to this change.

DocImpact: glance workers will now be equal to the number of
           CPUs available by default if not explicitly specified
           in glance-api.conf and/or glance-registry.conf.

UpgradeImpact: There is no upgrade impact to glance-api workers
           since glance-api.conf previously hard-coded the workers
           value to 1 so anyone upgrading to tihs will still get
           whatever value was set in glance-api.conf prior to
           this change. There is an upgrade impact to the
           glance-registry workers since glance-registry.conf
           did not hard-code the workers value to 1 before change
           I0cee0d284eef9ce5dcb26720499f2c4d31eaca0f, which is
           overwritten here. So anyone upgrading to this change
           that does not have workers specified in
           glance-registry.conf will now be running multiple
           workers by default when they restart the glance
           registry service.

Closes-Bug: #1333325

Change-Id: I6795c6e22268bb3fb67331edc7af641aefa904cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/65/102665/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from glance.openstack.common import processutils cfg.IntOpt('workers', 'created to service API requests. The default will be ' 'equal to the number of CPUs available.')), workers = (getattr(CONF, 'workers', None) or processutils.get_worker_count()) if workers == 0: self.logger.info(_("Starting %d workers") % workers) while len(self.children) < workers:
deleted_lines: cfg.IntOpt('workers', default=1, 'created to service API requests.')), if CONF.workers == 0: self.logger.info(_("Starting %d workers") % CONF.workers) while len(self.children) < CONF.workers:
